item.description:
I know this may be a long ride for some, But I am taking my other Meet-Up Group  and you are more than welcome to join us. 

One of my Favorite Bike Paths.  The Ride  takes you thru two swamps, from the comfy of a tarred path.  I have seen Deer along the path and plenty of birds.  They added another small section to one end, but it has a hill.  Do not worry, the hill is downhill both directions.  I was  planning  to stay on the path, but the Weather is looking so nice for Sunday, that I might visit Narragansett Pier and the Towers.  It is only about 2 miles from the new extension.  If you have never been, you will be riding along the Ocean.  Great Views.   A perfect place for our break.   

 

       You can ride 6,12, or 19 miles.  ( or anything in between) If you want to ride more, please let me know and I'll be glad to accommodate. You can set your own pace. I usually split into a few Groups, so everyone can ride at a pace they feel comfortable with.  Feel free to stop and see the scenery.  This is not a race.  There is a restroom at the train station.  

 

 

 

      Directions: 95 South / Exit 9, Route 4 South / Route 1 South / Route 138 West / go 4 Miles Left at Light on Route 108 / at the Light go  Right on Curtis Corner Rd. ( NOTE : Sign may say Saugatucket Rd ) / School is down on the Right.
item.how_to_find_us: We are in the School Parking Lot, on the Right.
item.name: Bike the Wakefield Bike Path
